result.execSummary:
The defendant William D. Steele was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence credit of 52 days were granted.  Time Served.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William D. Steele

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant William D. Steele in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count #2 is dismissed and read in.  The Defendant is sentenced as follows: 

Count #1:

JAIL: 52 days, (Apply 52 Days Credit) TIME SERVED.

Costs:  WAIVED by the Court. 

DNA SURCHARGE:  WAIVED.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
From Atty Bricco dated 12/30/15 requesting to have a plea and sentencing scheduled.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.

Defendant William D. Steele in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court calls the matter to address the bail motion.  Attorney Bricco requests the court modify the bail to a signature bond. The State objects to the bail modification and request bail remain as set.    The Court denies the bail motion.  Bail remains as set.    Attorney Bricco enters a request for a speedy trial demand.  Jury status hearing scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Modification filed by defendant.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint including the victim's residence.    Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant William D. Steele in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
